thread.title: EastEnders star Danny Dyer flies to South Africa after being given break from BBC soap
thread.title_full: EastEnders star Danny Dyer flies to South Africa after being given break from BBC soap

author: Halina Watts
title: EastEnders star Danny Dyer flies to South Africa after being given break from BBC soap
text:
Celebs EastEnders star Danny Dyer flies to South Africa after being given break from BBC soap Dyer has vowed to properly rest for the sake of his family especially after his wife Jo Mas had been left “fuming” following a series of rows Share Danny Dyer poses with fans Share Get soaps   
EastEnders star Danny Dyer has flown to South Africa after being given a break from the BBC soap. 
The 39-year-old actor, who plays Mick Carter, supped a couple of beers on the long haul flight with onlookers saying he looked tired. 
He has vowed to properly rest for the sake of his family. 
A source said: “Danny knows he has to rest-up and recuperate. He has been ground down by the workload on EastEnders and then partying on top of it. 
“This trip is going to do him the world of good. He can remain anonymous there and he can properly rest." Dyer reportedly flew to South Africa (Photo: ©Sunday Mirror / MGN Limited) 
The source added that before Danny took the trip on February 10 things had got a bit tense between him and wife Jo, also 39. 
The childhood sweethearts we last September after 25 years together. They have three children. 
The source added: "He and Jo have had a few rows but they sorted it out. He's hoping to come back refreshed and back into work." 
The TV favourite, who has played the Queen Vic landlord since 2013, was spotted at a check-in desk at Heathrow airport before catching a flight to a South African city. After arriving he posed for a picture with excited young fans. Read More 
An eyewitness said: “Danny was traveling by himself on an evening flight. He had a porter dealing with his luggage, but other than that he was flying solo. 
“He kept his head down and was checking his phone. 
“He was flying first class and sat in the lounge on his iPad drinking a couple of beers. On the flight the attendants brought him several more." Danny and Joanne Mas (Photo: XPOSUREPHOTOS.COM) 
Sources said Danny had been feeling the pressure after a hectic work schedule and a series of incidents. 
He took a ribbing over a fire at his mum Christina’s house, following which a cannabis factory was discovered growing in the roof. 
A man of 29 was held for alleged cultivation of the drug. Read More EastEnders' Bex releases heartbreaking song about Shakil split in full 
That incident came a month after Danny claimed he was jumped by five of Mark Wright’s pals at the V Festival. 
A source said: “It all just got a bit too much. He’s portrayed as a hard man but he’s a softie really and everyone needs some time out once in a while.” 
On Friday EastEnders bosses said: “Danny is on a short break. This was not enforced by us, nor has he quit.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
